description:
A typical morning. The usual music. Their normal lives. The peace these seven girls experience will suddenly be destroyed. By the living dead... zombies. A reality that they never wanted a part of, an amazing and terrifying zombie world. They all share one wish: "We want to live." These girls will struggle through this saga, in order to achieve a miracle. MAPPA, Avex Pictures, and Cygames team up to bring you a juicy, 100% original anime. A timeless shocker for all audiences, a brand new style of zombie anime, will soon rise.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Satire
tags.description: Prominently features the use of comedy or ridicule to expose and criticise social phenomena.

tags.name: Necromancy
tags.description: When the dead are summoned as spirits, skeletons, or the undead, usually for the purpose of gaining information or to be used as a weapon.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Dancing
tags.description: Centers around the art of dance.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Oiran
tags.description: Prominently features a courtesan character of the Japanese Edo Period.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Motorcycles
tags.description: Prominently features the use of motorcycles.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Hip-hop Music
tags.description: Centers on the musical style of hip-hop, not to be applied to anime that use hip-hop in its soundtrack.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/munehisa_sakai)

Previoulsy affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/Toei-Animation) and [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA). Currently working at [Studio KAI](https://anilist.co/studio/6312/Studio-KAI).

__Agency:__ Office Osawa
 
[Profile](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/tanedarisa/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tane_da_dayo/)

On September 1, 2016, Office Osawa announced that Taneda would put her career on hiatus to focus on treatment for her throat, various roles she done were recast during this time such as Erina Nakiri from Food Wars who was replaced by Hisako Kanemoto from Season 3 and onwards.

On August 4, 2017, Office Osawa announced that her treatment was successful and she would gradually return to voice acting.

__Non-anime roles:__
~!
• D.Va in "Overwatch" (VG)
• Kuon in Utawarerumono (VG series)
• Shirasu Azusa in Blue Archive (VG)
!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/4_7t)

Affiliated with [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

[Blog](http://blog.amuse.co.jp/tanoasami/p/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/asami_manager) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tano_asami/)

Asami Tano is a Japanese actress and voice actress from Hyōgo Prefecture, Japan. She is affiliated with Amuse, Inc. Her voice acting career began with Toriko in 2011, and she has starred in several anime such as Smile PreCure, Francesca, Love Live! Sunshine!!, and Zombie Land Saga.

On 13 December 2021, she announced her marriage to [Ryou Kitamura](https://anilist.co/staff/128201).

**Non-Anime Roles:**
- Citlali - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Fediel -Granblue Fantasy (VG)

[Profile (81 Produce)](https://www.81produce.co.jp/dcms_plusdb/index.php/item?cell003=%E3%81%9F%E8%A1%8C&cell029=%E5%A5%B3%E6%80%A7&keyword=&cell028=&cell004=&name=%E7%94%B0%E4%B8%AD%E3%80%80%E7%BE%8E%E6%B5%B7&id=242&label=1) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/minazou_373) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/minazou_in_sta/)

Announced her marriage on November 22, 2023.

**Non-anime roles:**
- [Alice](https://anilist.co/character/292758/Tendou-Alice) - Blue Archive (Video Game)
- Linaria - Granblue Fantasy (Video Game)
- Urakaze, Wakaba - Azur Lane (Video Game)
- Rover (Female) - Wuthering Waves (Video Game)

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Agency Profile](https://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=78) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Hondo_dagaya_)

A Japanese voice actor affiliated with I'm Enterprise.

Hondo had an interest in anime from a young age, in particular the [Naruto](https://anilist.co/anime/20/) series. She became interested in acting and modelling while in elementary school. She made her voice acting debut in 2015, and later that same year, she was cast in her first main role as [Kokoro Yotsuba](https://anilist.co/character/134716/), the protagonist of the anime series [Kamisama Minarai: Himitsu no Cocotama](https://anilist.co/anime/21237/).

She won Best New Actress at the 13th Seiyuu Awards for her role as [Hitomi Mishima](https://anilist.co/character/89230/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Lunalynn - Memento Mori (VG)
- Novel - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Ciel - Tsukihime -A piece of blue glass moon- (VN)
- Voyager - Reverse: 1999 (VG)
- Ajitani Hifumi - Blue Archive (VG)
- Phoebe - Wuthering Waves (VG) 
- Motoha Arai - Persona 5: The Phantom X (VG)
[Profile](https://www.artsvision.co.jp/talent/608/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/kawasemaki/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/maki_kawase) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/chan_maki_kawase/)

**Height:** 157cm

[Profile](https://firstwind.co.jp/talentpage/kinugawa_rika/)

She is a voice actress currently affiliated with FIRST WIND. Previously she was under With Line.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nassy_takanashi) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nassy_takanashi/) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/64mecceQewFCKwCK6JBW0o)
Affiliated with KUSANAGI.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/munehisa_sakai)

Previoulsy affiliated with [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/Toei-Animation) and [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/MAPPA). Currently working at [Studio KAI](https://anilist.co/studio/6312/Studio-KAI).
__Gender:__ Female
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/TAK_yana)

Aspired to become an animator when he saw [Macross: Do You Remember Love?](https://anilist.co/anime/1089/), while in elementary school. He studied art in middle school and high school, and later enrolled to a university with an animation department. There he was set on either moving to the United States or Japan to study abroad, and ended up choosing Japan due to how popular hand-drawn animation was there. After moving to Japan and graduating from Chiyoda Institute of Technology and Arts, he joined [Studio Comet](https://anilist.co/studio/126/) in 2005 and began his career in the industry.

He later joined [MAPPA](https://anilist.co/studio/569/) after getting scouted out by the studio's founder, [Masao Maruyama](https://anilist.co/staff/103170/).

Debuted as a director in 2017 with [Garo: Vanishing Line](https://anilist.co/anime/99796/).

In March 2021 he established the [E&H Production](https://anilist.co/studio/7229) studio becoming its Representative.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/KBeeThatsMe) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/katelynbarrva/)

Jad is an American voice actress and ADR director who works for Funimation and Sentai Filmworks. Her name is an acronym of her parents' names, Jimmy and David, and is pronounced as Jade. Her singing led to her first voice role in Sasami: Magical Girls Club as Eimi Mori, and her first major voice role was Masako Hara in Ghost Hunt. She graduated summa cum laude from Texas Wesleyan University with a Bachelor of Arts in Music in 2005.

(Source: Wikipedia)
